intro: Calotis cuneata var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy calotis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in heads. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy soils. This variety is noted for its resilience to drought and its ability to propagate through both seeds and vegetative means.
